title.narrative: An enabling environment for implementation of WPS commitments is created

description.narrative: This outcome will address exclusion of women from peacebuilding and state building opportunities to recover, to gain justice for human rights abuses, and to participate in shaping reformed laws and public security institutions. The work under this outcome will strengthen capacities of the Government to implement, monitor and finance the National Action Plan on Security Council Resolution. Recognizing the importance of collective action and the importance of CSOs to hold government accountable, the outcome will strengthen capacity and facilitate coordination of community-based women-led groups, and CSOs to advocate for implementation of gender equality commitments.

Institutional capacity of the Government at national (MSS, MOJ, MOI, SEII) and municipal levels strengthened to formulate, implement and monitor gender-responsive policies and plans, in line with WPS Agenda.

description.narrative: This output will more specifically look at supporting DNPCC to implement the Gender Responsive Mediation Guidelines, support to MSS and MOJ will be through the work of the mediation technical committee and the NAP secretariat.

title.narrative: Number of staff at DNPCC/MSS/MOI with capacity to train using the Gender Responsive Mediation Guidelines

description.narrative: This indicator will measure the number of staff from DNPCC/MSS/MOI who have capacity to train others using the Gender Responsive Mediation Guidelines. This will be measured through the observations of the trainiers and reported in their monitoring report
